targets.query:
from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router" and r._field == "gauge" and r.direction == "in")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "requests" and r._field == "count" and r.layer == "pipe")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "requests" and r._field == "count" and r.layer == "backend")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router.response-time" and r._field == "mean")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router.response-time" and r._field == "stddev")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router.response-time" and r._field == "max")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: max)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.Alloc")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "NumGoroutine")
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "responses" and r._field == "count" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> group(columns: ["name","status"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router.response-time" and r._field == "mean" and r.host =~ /${host}/ and r._value > 0)
    |> group(columns: ["name"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "router" and r._field == "gauge" and r.direction == "in" and r.host =~ /${host}/)

    |> yield()

panels.description: HeapIdle minus HeapReleased estimates the amount of memory that could be returned to the OS, but is being retained by the runtime so it can grow the heap without requesting more memory from the OS. If this difference is significantly larger than the heap size, it indicates there was a recent transient spike in live heap size.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.HeapReleased" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

panels.title: Idle Memory

panels.description: HeapInuse minus HeapAlloc estimates the amount of memory that has been dedicated to particular size classes, but is not currently being used. This is an upper bound on fragmentation, but in general this memory can be reused efficiently.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.HeapAlloc" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.HeapInuse" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: mean)
    |> yield()

panels.title: Heap Alloc vs InUse

targets.query:
from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.Lookups" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.Frees" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()

from(bucket: "krakend")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "runtime" and r._field == "MemStats.Mallocs" and r.host =~ /${host}/)
    |> group(columns: ["host"], mode: "by")
    |> aggregateWindow(every: ${resolution}, fn: sum)
    |> yield()
